#Text=Explosions at Brussels airport and subway systems
#Text=Tuesday , March 22 , 2016
#Text=At least 26 people , according to Belgian officials , have been killed and many more have been injured today following attacks on transport infrastructure in Brussels , the capital of Belgium .
#Text=Authorities have stated one of the explosions , at approximately 08:00 ( Central European Time , UTC+1 ) in the check-in area at Brussels Airport , was likely conducted by a suicide bomber .
#Text=There was a subsequent attack at the Maelbeek/Maalbeek metro station , very close to the offices of the European Commission and the Council of the European Union .
#Text=Locations of the attacks in Brussels .
#Text=Image : Rauletemunoz .
#Text=Passengers at the metro station were forced to walk along tracks to escape the blast .
#Text=The Brussels metro system has been shut down .
#Text=Jef Versele , a business traveller intending to fly to Rome , witnessed the events at the airport .
#Text=In remarks to NBC News , he said , " There was dust everywhere , glass everywhere

#Text=Charles Michel , Belgium 's Prime Minister , described the attacks as  blind , violent and cowardly " and a " dark moment for our country " .

column1: #Text=Donald Tusk , the president of the European Council , said : " These attacks mark another low by the terrorists in the service of hatred and violence "
#Text=The French President , François Hollande , has held a cabinet meeting to discuss security .
#Text=After the meeting , Hollande said " terrorists struck Brussels but it was Europe that was targeted " .
#Text=The French Prime Minister , Manuel Valls , said : " we are at war .

#Text=He said he was  shocked and concerned by the events in Brussels " and pledged Britain would do " everything we can to help " .

column1: #Text=U.S. President Barack Obama has been briefed on the attack during his trip in Cuba .
#Text=The U.S. Embassy in Brussels has advised U.S. citizens in Belgium to not use public transport and to stay where they are .
